clinical_question: Should patients with RA on MTX + boDMARD or MTX + tsDMARD who are at target withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) MTX or withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) the boDMARD or the tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on MTX + boDMARD or MTX + tsDMARD who are at target
intervention: Withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) MTX
outcome: Disease activity (follow up: 3 months; assessed with: DAS28-ESR (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -1.17)

Risk of bias.rationales: Concern with risk of bias. Missing data was not appropriately handled in the trial.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Very small sample size.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA on MTX + boDMARD or MTX + tsDMARD who are at target withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) MTX or withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) the boDMARD or the tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on MTX + boDMARD or MTX + tsDMARD who are at target
intervention: Withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) MTX
outcome: Disability (follow up: 3 months; assessed with: HAQ-DI (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -0.22)

Risk of bias.rationales: Concern with risk of bias. Missing data was not appropriately handled in the trial.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Very small sample size.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA on MTX + boDMARD or MTX + tsDMARD who are at target withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) MTX or withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) the boDMARD or the tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on MTX + boDMARD or MTX + tsDMARD who are at target
intervention: Withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) MTX
outcome: Quality of life (follow up: 3 months; assessed with: SF-36 PCS (Higher values – > benefit) (MCID 4.4)

Risk of bias.rationales: Concern with risk of bias. Missing data was not appropriately handled in the trial.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting no effect and values suggesting benefit. Very small sample size.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA on MTX + boDMARD or MTX + tsDMARD who are at target withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) MTX or withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) the boDMARD or the tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on MTX + boDMARD or MTX + tsDMARD who are at target
intervention: Withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) MTX
outcome: Quality of life (follow up: 3 months; assessed with:  SF-36 MCS (Higher values – > benefit) (MCID 3.1)

Risk of bias.rationales: Concern with risk of bias. Missing data was not appropriately handled in the trial.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting no effect and values suggesting harm. Very small sample size.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA on MTX + boDMARD or MTX + tsDMARD who are at target withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) MTX or withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) the boDMARD or the tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on MTX + boDMARD or MTX + tsDMARD who are at target
intervention: Withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) MTX

Risk of bias.rationales: Concern with risk of bias. Missing data was not appropriately handled in the trial.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Very small sample size, and low number of events.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA on MTX + boDMARD or MTX + tsDMARD who are at target withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) MTX or withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) the boDMARD or the tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on MTX + boDMARD or MTX + tsDMARD who are at target
intervention: Withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) MTX
outcome: Withdrawal due to lack of efficacy (follow up: 3 months)

Risk of bias.rationales: Concern with risk of bias. Missing data was not appropriately handled in the trial.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Very small sample size, and low number of events.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio
